snippet.title: Pokémon: Best Wishes game for the Sega Beena
snippet.description:
Continuing this very unusual relationship of Nintendo allowing their own IPs (just Pokémon as far as I know) on Sega's hardware (technically Sega Toys), this is the latest of a few Pokémon Anime games on the Beena, just as Pokémon Anime games appreared on the Sega Pico before it. 

Here's a high-res box shot of the Beena Lite (where've I heard Lite before? ;) ) bundled with the new Best Wishes saga game:

http://z2-ec2.images-amazon.com/images/P/B003VPYN7M.01._SCRMZZZZZZ_.jpg

And here's the official Beena product page:

http://www.beena.jp/sd/soft/pokemon_bw.html

So in general, the Pico looked around 16-bit in power, I'd say the Beena is around 32-bit in 2D power anyway, nothing overly advanced, but it gets the job done for what it's doing. :)
